title: BBC Local Live: Northamptonshire on Thursday, 2 June 2016 - BBC News
summary: northampton borough council has reached an agreement with developers behind the st james waste-to-energy plant giving them a two-year option on westbridge depot .
the opening of the under-restoration delapre abbey will not be completed until february 2017 , having originally been scheduled for this summer .
the interim head of the fire service has revealed the number of vehicles jointly manned by police and fire officers in the county is to increase to 14 .
news , sport , travel and weather updates resume on friday at 08:00 .

documents.title: our live coverage across the day
text: thanks for joining us today .

there 's been plenty going on , from a rushden shoe company in new york , new york to plans for new joint working police and fire vehicles ; delays at delapre to discussions over the st james waste-to-energy plant .
if you want to catch up with anything just scroll down the page .
otherwise , we 'll be back at 08:00 tomorrow .

documents.title: weather : mild night in store , another cloudy day tomorrow
text: a mild night ahead , especially if you happen to be in built-up areas .
the odd spot of rain ca n't be ruled out but it should stay dry for the most part .
tomorrow 's set to be mostly cloudy with a little showery rain spreading from the east , so if you were hoping for summer you 're not in luck .
highs of 15c , that 's 59f .
you can always check the latest forecast for where you live on the bbc weather website .

documents.title: eu referendum facebook live : time to ask your questions
text: our bbc east political team of andrew sinclair and tom barton will be hosting a facebook live event tonight , answering your questions on the eu referendum in the east from 18:45 .
you can ask questions via facebook comments during the broadcast , but if you 'd like to get in early , you can post them here .

documents.title: planned pathway at delapre abbey will take six to eight weeks to finish
text: the latest stage in the work to prepare for the opening of delapre abbey will see a new footpath built , which will take an anticipated six to eight weeks to complete .
it is intended the path will be able to cope with increased visitor numbers once the restoration is complete .
with such an increase in numbers , we need to make sure all of the facilities are up to scratch , including approach routes . ''

documents.title: delapre abbey delay comes after council discovered £ 900,000 funding black hole
text: a fully-restored delapre abbey was scheduled to be opened by summer 2016 , but by april the borough council was saying it would not be open until october this year .
that delay came at the same time as the news it would cost the authority an extra £ 900,000 to complete the work .
now the date has been put back again until february 2017 .
author: Craig Lewis
BBC News

documents.title: opening of restored dealpre abbey delayed until february 2017
text: the opening of delapre abbey has been delayed until february next year .
a £ 6.3m heritage lottery-funded scheme to restore the abbey was originally set to be completed by summer 2016 , when the building was due to open for the first time in 900 years .
but , according to the delapre abbey website , a `` revised '' date of saturday , 11 february 2017 has now been set in order to `` allow us to complete all the detailed restoration work '' .
author: Craig Lewis
BBC News

documents.title: watch : shoe company makes it in new york
text: a shoe company has celebrated its 150th anniversary by opening its first store outside of the uk - in new york .
grenson shoes , of rushden , already has several stores across the uk and says the new shop is a natural progression .
the new york outlet is 3,500 miles ( 5,633km ) away from grenson 's rushden roots .
author: Rob Adcock
BBC News

documents.title: watch : piles of rubbish dumped at fishponds removed by volunteers
text: black bags full of shredded paper .
sofas and armchairs .
bike helmets .
sleeping bags .
just some of the items found during a `` day of action '' , carried out by volunteers at fishponds on the southbrook estate in daventry .
i spoke to the co-ordinator of the clean and green project in daventry , angelina farrant
author: Martin Heath
BBC Radio Northampton

documents.title: fly-tipping a major problem on southbrook estate
text: volunteers have been busy clearing up the fishponds area of daventry 's southbrook estate this afternoon .
judging by what they have found , fly-tipping is a major issue in the area
author: Martin Heath
BBC Radio Northampton

documents.title: cricket : three out of three the key for rampant levi
text: in-form northamptonshire batsman richard levi is looking to propel the county to a third t20 victory tomorrow night .

speaking to me today , levi - who smashed 61 and 58 in wins against leicestershire and derbyshire - said the `` very supportive '' wantage road crowd and confidence throughout the team would hopefully propel the team to three wins out of three .
northants take on worcestershire at the county ground tomorrow evening .
author: Joe Townsend
BBC Radio Northampton sport

documents.title: student goes coast to coast to create fashion design
text: what do the coasts of cornwall and new york have in common ?
they 're both featured in the fashion of university of northampton student sean leggett , whose final-year collection will represent the uni at this year 's graduate fashion week .
the coastal clash design combined gold to represent cornwall - as sean associated it with a laid-back surfer-dude vibe - and silver for new york to represent the steel of the towering skyscrapers .
graduate fashion week takes place from 5-8 june in shoreditch .

documents.title: headstone crushed by lead thieves
text: a headstone was crushed and destroyed by thieves stealing lead from a church roof .
the incident at middleton cheney was one of two at churches in the county over the past week .
the other took place in thenford .
significant amounts of lead were taken and damage caused during the thefts .

documents.title: hand-built model steam engine and family car stolen in burton latimer burglary
text: a one-of-a-kind hand-built model steam engine has been stolen .
the 1:8 scale model of an allchin royal chester , serial number sh207 , was taken from a house in churchill way , burton latimer at 20:40 on tuesday .

police say it is of great sentimental value to its owners , adding they believe it may have been transported in a land rover freelander , registration kg03 ojj , which was also stolen from the property .

documents.title: what a load of rubbish daventry day of action clean-up
text: i 've been out with residents on a day of action to clear up the southbrook estate in daventry - and this is just some of the rubbish found there
author: Martin Heath
BBC Radio Northampton

documents.title: weather watchers brighten up dull day across the county
text: it 's not raining .
that 's about as positive as i can get about the weather today , but that has n't stopped our eager weather watchers .
these were taken by weather watcher 66 in wellingborough , paulamaria in pattishall and rosemary in kettering .
author: Craig Lewis
BBC News

documents.title: st james waste-to-energy plant : your views
text: we 've been asking you what you think of proposals for a waste-to-energy plant in st james - after the council reached an agreement with developer rolton kilbride giving it a two-year option on the westbridge depot .
the debate is taking place on our facebook page .
author: Craig Lewis
BBC News

documents.title: hand-built model steam engine and family car stolen in burton latimer burglary
text: a one-of-a-kind hand-built model steam engine has been stolen .
the 1:8 scale model of an allchin royal chester , serial number sh207 , was taken from a house in churchill way , burton latimer at 20:40 on tuesday .

police say it is of great sentimental value to its owners , adding they believe it may have been transported in a land rover freelander , registration kg03 ojj , which was also stolen from the property .

documents.title: st james waste-to-energy plant : the opposition
text: protesters opposing plans for a waste-to-energy plant in st james say information given to them has `` constantly changed '' .
chairman of st james residents ' association , graham croucher , told the bbc last week that there are question marks over proposals residents will be given a share of the profits .
the 'nomoinnoho ' - or no monster incinerator in northampton - has also raised objections over the size and environmental quality of the proposed plant .
author: Craig Lewis
BBC News

documents.title: two-year agreement would give waste plant developers a 'degree of certainty '
text: northampton borough council has given developer rolton kilbride a two-year option on st james ' westbridge depot .
there is a clause in the agreement that would allow the authority to extend the option for a further period .
this would allow rolton kilbride to proceed with its plans with a degree of certainty that , pending planning approval , the scheme could go ahead . ''

documents.title: rolton kilbride waste-to-energy plan would 'have to be considered carefully '
text: a report on the proposed st james waste-to-energy plant is due to go before northampton borough council 's cabinet next wednesday .
if a property deal is agreed , rolton kilbride will have two years to submit a planning application , secure other approvals and carry out a public consultation .
cabinet member for regeneration , tim hadland , said : `` this could provide the best option for the taxpayers of northampton , but is something that will have to be considered carefully . ''
author: Craig Lewis
BBC News

documents.title: st james waste-to-energy plant developer given two-year option on westbridge depot
text: it 's one of the most controversial plans in northampton - but has today been given tacit backing by the borough council .
rolton kilbride is planning to build a waste-to-energy plant at the old westbridge depot in st james .
northampton borough council has now reached a commercial agreement with the developer giving it a two-year option on the depot .
author: Craig Lewis
BBC News

documents.title: new police and fire vehicles : 'where will the officers come from ? '
text: northants police federation chairman gez jackson says he was previously involved in meetings about joint police and fire working but `` they stopped last summer '' .
despite being broadly in favour of integration , he did question where extra officers to man 12 new 4x4s would come from .
resources are stretched and i 'm not entirely sure where these officers will come from , but i have n't been consulted . ''
author: Craig Lewis
BBC News

documents.title: rank-and-file representative 'positive ' about fire and police integration
text: the head of the organisation that represents rank-and-file police officers in northamptonshire says he is `` positive '' about integration between the police and fire services .
gez jackson , chairman of the county 's police federation , said the sharing of the police 's wootton hall headquarters with the fire service had been a success .

mr jackson said the federation had not been consulted about plans to increase the number of joint vehciels from two to 14 , but said he was not `` anti '' the overall aims of blue-light collaboration .
author: Craig Lewis
BBC News

documents.title: police federation chairman found out about new police and fire 4x4s from the bbc
text: `` your phone call was the first i had heard of it . ''

that was the reaction from a `` disappointed '' gez jackson , the chairman of the northants police federation , when i asked him about plans to increase the number of joint 4x4s manned by both police and fire officers .
the move was revealed by fire brigade chief , darren dovey , who also said communications within the police and fire services on blue-light integration needs to improve .
work still to do ?
i ca n't comment as to the benefits as i was n't involved in the process . ''
author: Craig Lewis
BBC News

documents.title: weather : dry and breezy but keep your coat on
text: it should be a nicer day than the past few have been .
overall it will be dry and breezy , although that wind will be chilly at times .
top temperature : 15c ( 59f ) .
author: Elizabeth Rizzini
BBC Look East weather

documents.title: joint vehicles aimed at solving rural issues , says fire boss
text: the interim head of northamptonshire fire service , darren dovey , has been talking about the increase of joint police and fire vehicles across the county .
here 's what he had to say
author: Sam Read
BBC Radio Northampton politics reporter

documents.title: what the joint police and fire vehicles do ?
text: the first joint rural response vehicle was launched in east northamptonshire in january last year .
the number of vehicles in the county is now due to be increased to 14 , but what do they do ?
according to a police spokesman , at the time that first vehicle was launched , they are staffed by a police officer and a fire officer whose role is to :
author: Craig Lewis
BBC News

documents.title: when danny met adam : bbc 's man tried out new patrol vehicle in daventry
text: back in april , the bbc 's home affairs correspondent danny shaw looked into the roles of police and crime commissioners across the country - including proposals for blue-light collaboration .
under the policing and crime bill , currently going through parliament , commissioners can take responsibility for fire and rescue services and create a single employer for the two services .
he even went on patrol in daventry in one of two purpose-built intervention vehicles .

it 's part of a move to reduce costs , cut duplication and improve response times to traffic accidents and other emergencies , driven by the conservative pcc , adam simmonds , and is likely to be replicated in other areas . ''

documents.title: fire boss admits joint working communications errors
text: if your plan is to integrate two major services , one of the first things you should get right is making sure there is a consistent message to the staff within them .
but that 's something northamptonshire 's interim fire service chief , darren dovey , admits was n't up to scratch .
he said : `` i think we could have joined up our comms a lot better between police and fire to ensure we had one message going out . ''
author: Sam Read
BBC Radio Northampton politics reporter

documents.title: buildings are main priority in joint police and fire plan
text: this latest development may be concentrating on vehicles , but interim fire service chief , darren dovey , says the plan 's main focus remains on buildings .
it 's about police and fire getting together to see if we can come up with an estates strategy .
that is the immediate thing for integration . ''
author: Craig Lewis
BBC News

documents.title: 'blue-light collaboration ' plan first hatched in 2013
text: the increased number of jointly manned 4x4s in northamptonshire is the latest move in the development of `` blue-light collaboration '' in the county .
plans by former northamptonshire police and crime commissioner , adam simmonds , to merge some police and fire service functions were backed by the police crime panel back in 2013 .

in the same year , officers and support staff from both forces moved into a newly-refurbished fire station in thrapston and , in 2014 , northamptonshire county council approved draft plans to merge the services .
author: Craig Lewis
BBC News

documents.title: joint police and fire engines in northamptonshire to increase to 14
text: the number of joint 4x4s manned by both police and fire officers is to be increased to cover the whole county .
a pilot scheme has been running with two 4x4s responding to incidents where both police and fire could play a role .
but the interim head of northamptonshire fire service darren dovey says that will be increased to 14 vehicles .
author: Sam Read
BBC Radio Northampton politics reporter

documents.title: good morning and welcome to northamptonshire live
text: morning .
if your house is on fire , you 'd expect the fire brigade to show up - but perhaps things are n't that simple any more .
the interim head of the county 's fire service has announced the number of 4x4s manned by both police and fire officers will be increasing from two to 14 .
good idea ?
we 'll be kicking off our live page this morning by talking about blue-light collaboration .
author: Craig Lewis
BBC News
